pageProps.contentHtml:
harmonic functions
  1. Find a real-valued harmonic function vvv defined on the disk ∣z∣<1\abs{z} < 1∣z∣<1 such that v(z)>0v\p{z} > 0v(z)>0 and lim⁡z→1v(z)=∞\lim_{z\to1} v\p{z} = \inftylimz→1​v(z)=∞.
  2. Let uuu be a real-valued harmonic function in the disk ∣z∣<1\abs{z} < 1∣z∣<1 such that u(z)≤M<∞u\p{z} \leq M < \inftyu(z)≤M<∞ and lim sup⁡r→1u(reiθ)≤0\limsup_{r\to1} u\p{re^{i\theta}} \leq 0limsupr→1​u(reiθ)≤0 for all θ∈(0,2π)\theta \in \p{0, 2\pi}θ∈(0,2π). Show that u(z)≤0u\p{z} \leq 0u(z)≤0. The function in part (1) is useful here.
Solution.

  1. Observe that the conformal mapping φ ⁣:H→D\func{\phi}{\H}{\D}φ:H→D, φ(z)=z−iz+i\phi\p{z} = \frac{z - i}{z + i}φ(z)=z+iz−i​ maps R‾→D\cl{\R} \to \DR→D, so it suffices to find a positive harmonic function on H\HH which is unbounded as ∣z∣→∞\abs{z} \to \infty∣z∣→∞. The function u(z)=log⁡ ∣z+i∣u\p{z} = \log\,\abs{z + i}u(z)=log∣z+i∣ works: if Im⁡z>0\Im{z} > 0Imz>0, then

    ∣z+i∣2=∣Re⁡z∣2+∣iIm⁡z+i∣2≥∣Im⁡z+1∣2>1,\abs{z + i}^2 = \abs{\Re{z}}^2 + \abs{i\Im{z} + i}^2 \geq \abs{\Im{z} + 1}^2 > 1,∣z+i∣2=∣Rez∣2+∣iImz+i∣2≥∣Imz+1∣2>1,

    so u(z)>0u\p{z} > 0u(z)>0 on H\HH. Furthermore, it is clear that uuu is unbounded as ∣z∣→∞\abs{z} \to \infty∣z∣→∞, and so

    v(z)=u(φ−1(z))=log⁡ ∣i1+z1−z+i∣=log⁡ ∣1+z1−z+1∣v\p{z} = u\p{\phi^{-1}\p{z}} = \log\,\abs{i\frac{1 + z}{1 - z} + i} = \log\,\abs{\frac{1 + z}{1 - z} + 1}v(z)=u(φ−1(z))=log∣∣​i1−z1+z​+i∣∣​=log∣∣​1−z1+z​+1∣∣​

    works.

  2. For r>0r > 0r>0, let ur(z)=u(rz)u_r\p{z} = u\p{rz}ur​(z)=u(rz), which is a harmonic function on a neighborhood of D‾\cl{\D}D. We have the Poisson integral for uru_rur​:

    ur(teiθ)=12π∫02π1−∣t∣2∣eiθ−teiθ∣2ur(eiθ) dθ=12π∫02π1−∣t∣2∣eiθ−teiθ∣2u(reiθ) dθ.u_r\p{te^{i\theta}} = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \frac{1 - \abs{t}^2}{\abs{e^{i\theta} - te^{i\theta}}^2} u_r\p{e^{i\theta}} \,\diff\theta = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \frac{1 - \abs{t}^2}{\abs{e^{i\theta} - te^{i\theta}}^2} u\p{re^{i\theta}} \,\diff\theta.ur​(teiθ)=2π1​∫02π​∣eiθ−teiθ∣21−∣t∣2​ur​(eiθ)dθ=2π1​∫02π​∣eiθ−teiθ∣21−∣t∣2​u(reiθ)dθ.

    Observe that the integrand grg_rgr​ is bounded:

    ∣1−∣t∣2∣eiθ−teiθ∣2ur(eiθ)∣≤M1−t2≕A.\abs{\frac{1 - \abs{t}^2}{\abs{e^{i\theta} - te^{i\theta}}^2} u_r\p{e^{i\theta}}} \leq \frac{M}{1 - t^2} \eqqcolon A.∣∣​∣eiθ−teiθ∣21−∣t∣2​ur​(eiθ)∣∣​≤1−t2M​=:A.

    Hence, A−gr≥0A - g_r \geq 0A−gr​≥0, so by Fatou's lemma,

    12π∫02πlim inf⁡r→1 (A−1−∣t∣2∣eiθ−teiθ∣2u(reiθ)) dθ≤lim inf⁡r→112π∫02πA−1−∣t∣2∣eiθ−teiθ∣2u(reiθ) dθ  ⟹  lim sup⁡r→1 ur(teiθ)≤12π∫02π1−∣t∣2∣eiθ−teiθ∣2(lim sup⁡r→1u(reiθ)) dθ.\begin{gathered} \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \liminf_{r\to1}\,\p{A - \frac{1 - \abs{t}^2}{\abs{e^{i\theta} - te^{i\theta}}^2} u\p{re^{i\theta}}} \,\diff\theta \leq \liminf_{r\to1}\frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} A - \frac{1 - \abs{t}^2}{\abs{e^{i\theta} - te^{i\theta}}^2} u\p{re^{i\theta}} \,\diff\theta \\ \implies \limsup_{r\to1}\,u_r\p{te^{i\theta}} \leq \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \frac{1 - \abs{t}^2}{\abs{e^{i\theta} - te^{i\theta}}^2} \p{\limsup_{r\to1} u\p{re^{i\theta}}} \,\diff\theta. \end{gathered}2π1​∫02π​r→1liminf​(A−∣eiθ−teiθ∣21−∣t∣2​u(reiθ))dθ≤r→1liminf​2π1​∫02π​A−∣eiθ−teiθ∣21−∣t∣2​u(reiθ)dθ⟹r→1limsup​ur​(teiθ)≤2π1​∫02π​∣eiθ−teiθ∣21−∣t∣2​(r→1limsup​u(reiθ))dθ.​

    By construction, the left-hand side is u(teiθ)u\p{te^{i\theta}}u(teiθ) and the right-hand side is non-negative, and so this becomes

    u(teiθ)≤0,u\p{te^{i\theta}} \leq 0,u(teiθ)≤0,

    so u(z)≤0u\p{z} \leq 0u(z)≤0 on all of D\DD.
